H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1254.def: = causative action by which humans cause something else to get its desired shape by cutting off certain parts of it

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H979.def: = the period between childhood and maturity; applies to males only

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H3394.def: = one of the celestial bodies which govern time, seasons and other events on earth, marked by a white and cold light and seen by night

H3556.def: = celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

H2821.def: = process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

H5645.def: = mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H1653.def: = water that has fallen as rain

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H2111.def: = process by which (part of) the body of humans shakes or trembles violently and involuntarily, ◄ caused by fear, respect, or old age

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H5791.def: = process by which something becomes bent or twisted out of shape or position

H2912.def: = causative action by which humans reduce objects to tiny particles or powder with the help of a hand-mill or larger millstone; ≈ regarded as a menial task

H988.def: = state in which someone is no longer engaged in an action one used to be engaged in previously

H4591.def: = state in which humans or objects are relatively few in number

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2821.def: = process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

H1817.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H2913.def: = the action of stones of a hand-mill or a larger mill crushing grain into flour; ≈ an essential, daily activity

H6833.def: = small bird, speckled brown in color; found in abundance around towns and settlements; lives on grass and grain; ◄ Passer domesticus, Passer hispaniolensis, and Passer moabiticus; ► clean and can therefore be eaten

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H1364.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H2849.def: = event that causes people to lose their inner strength and courage

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H8247.def: = a tree belonging to the peach family; growing wild, and reaching a height of 4.5 to 6 m; it sheds its oblong leaves in winter and produces white or pink flowers and blooms as early as January; the leaves appear much later; ◄ Prunis dulcis; ► the seed is fifty percent oil, and can be eaten raw or roasted

H5006.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt

H2284.def: = type of migratory locust; consumes all vegetation; ◄ swarming creature with wings; ► clean animal which may be eaten; ≈ regarded as a small but destructive insect; its way of walking resembles that of an old man

H35.def: = plant with heavy, drooping branches; blooms in May and its large white flowers are open for only one night; ◄ Capparis Spinosa; ► its buds are pickled in vinegar and eaten as a condiment with meat; both fruit and buds are supposed to stimulate appetite; ≈ the eating of the fruit of this plant was believed to stimulate one's sexual desire

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5594.def: = action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H1543.def: = a round, deep dish or basin for the storage of liquids

H7533.def: = causative action by which humans destroy an object by using force to break it into two or more pieces

H3537.def: = artifact used as container, ◄ usually made of mud or ceramic, ► for different domestic purposes

H4002.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H1534.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made of a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outer rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground

H953.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6953.def: = man; ► author of biblical book of the same name (= Ecclesiastes); ◄ of uncertain meaning

H3148.def: = objects that remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way

H6953.def: = man; ► author of biblical book of the same name (= Ecclesiastes); ◄ of uncertain meaning

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H239.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H2713.def: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully

H8626.def: = state in which an object extends uniformly in one direction only, without a curve or bend; ≈ associated with just behavior

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H6953.def: = man; ► author of biblical book of the same name (= Ecclesiastes); ◄ of uncertain meaning

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H3476.def: = state in which humans are morally and ethically right

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H627.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = things brought together for a common purpose

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H4930.def: = thin piece of metal (usually iron) sharpened on one end; ► used for attaching pieces of wood to each other or to the floor; ≈ associated with permanence and reliability

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H3148.def: = objects that remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way

H2094.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects intense light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3854.def: exact meaning unsure: = effort to increase one's knowledge by reading and meditating

H3024.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
